A. Zollickotter

UNIONTOWN BUSINESS REFERENCES.

Jos. L. Haines, Water, Gas and Steam Fittings; Stoves,
Ranges and Furnaces for sale to order; Cast Iron,
Wrought Iron and Terra Cotta Pipe. Two and a
half miles southwest of Uniontown,

Theodore Hibberd, Raiser and Breeder of Dark and
Light Brahma Chickens.

Josiah Erbe, Breeder and Raiser of full blood Poland ¢

China Hogs.

Dennis Cookson, Manufacturer and Dealer in Spaer’s
Patent Farm Gates and Gifford’s Patent Cattle
Stanchions.

Philip H. Babylon, Farmer; also, Raiser and Breeder
of Thoroughbred Horses. One and a half miles
east of Uniontown. ‘

Jacob Koons offers his farm of 143 acres of good farming
land for sale. Well situated, good buildings, out-
houses, etc,

Wm. Zimmerman, Farmer, Manufacturer of Flour, Feed,
&c. Custom Work promptly done and satisfaction
guaranteed. ' One mile south of Frizelburg.

Chas, McFadden, Farmer and Manufacturer of Flour,
Feed, &c. Cash paid for Wheat, Raiser and
Breeder of Hambletonian Horses, Short Horn, Dur-
ham and Alderney Cattle.

John W, Nissley, Farmer, Manufacturer of Flour, Feed,
Pure Bone Dust, Pure Phosphate, &c, Custom
Sawing done to order. Two miles north of Union-
town.

G. W. Hull, Proprietor of Saw Mill. Keeps constantly
on hand Sawed Lumber, Felloes, &c. Cash paid’
for

J. Rinehart, Physician, Surgeon and Farmer, Frizel-
burg, Md.

William H. Hoffman, Proprietor of Tannery. Con-
stantly on hand Leather for sale. Highest cash
price paid for Bark and Hides, Uniontown, Md.

Noah H. Fleagle, Dealer in Dry Goods, Groceries,
Hats, Caps, Boots, Shoes, Notions and General
Merchandise, Mayberry Post-office.

W. L. Fleagle, Dealer in Dry Goods, Choice Family
Groceries, Hats, Caps, Boots, Shoes, Notions, &c.,
Mayberry Post-office, Md.

TANEYTOWN BUSINESS REFERENCES.

J» McKellip, Druggist. Proprietor of McKellip’s Cho-
lera and Diarrhcea Syrup.

Geo, A. Flickinger, Lime Burner and Dealer. Also,

ustice of the Peace and Conveyancer.

W. T. Haugh, Manufacturer of Threshing Machines
and Horse Powers, Corn Shellers, Horse Rakes,
Fanning Mills, &c. A stock of Plows, unsurpassed
in quality and at moderate prices. Repairing of all
kinds promptly done at reasonable rates. Give
us a call.

J. Davidson & Son, Dealers in General Hardware, Oils,
Paints, Glass, Putty, Cedarware, Leather, Hides,
&c., near Railroad Depot.

Jesse H. Haugh, Dealer in Dry Goods, Groceries, Hard-
ware, Queensware, Notions, Boots, Shoes, Hats,

C?r’ etc., etc.

Wm. H. Crouse, Proprietor of the “Union Hotel.
Best of accommodations for man and beast.

W. C. Merick, Repairer and Dealer in Clocks, Watches,
and Jewelr %’ederick Street, near the Square,

Adam Motter, Veterinary Surgeon, 2} miles southwest
of Taneytown.

Wm. A. Linn, Farmer and Dealer in choice Horses,
Hogs, Cattle, etc.

C. Birnie, Physician and Surgeon.

Levi Flickinger, Manufacturer of Monuments, Head-
stones, &c., in any desired style and finish, Orders
promptly attended to, Work delivered free of
charge. Give us a call.

Frank E. Roberts, Farmer. Also, Manufacturer of
Flour, Feed, &c. Custom Grinding promptly done
and satisfaction guaranteed. Also, Custom Sawing.
Cash paid for Wheat. Mills 3 miles east of Taney-
town,

Tho’s Angell, Dealer in Staple and Fancy Dry Goods,

Hats, Caps, Boots, Shoes, Iron, Nails, Glass, Oils,

Groceries, Queensware, Perfumery, &c. All kinds

of Country Produce taken in exchange for goods,

Copperville, 13{ miles southeast of Taneytown.
